alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Grant; Kenton; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, CAMPBELL, NORTHEASTERN GRANT AND NORTHWESTERN PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 213 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Crittenden, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Covington, Independence, Alexandria, Taylor Mill, Williamstown, Walton, Claryville, Crittenden, New Richmond, Dry Ridge, Silver Grove, Melbourne, Coldstream, Cold Spring, Ryland Heights, Crestview, Mentor, Fairview, California and Visalia. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 157 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
